snippet: After one officer shot Tamir Rice, 12, he and another officer stood by and did not help the wounded boy. An officer also tackled the boy’s sister.
abstract: Newly released surveillance video of fatal shooting of 12-year-old African-American boy Tamir Rice shows Cleveland police officers Timothy Loehmann and Frank Garmback standing by without offering medical assistance while Rice lay wounded next to their patrol car; video also shows Garmback tackling boy's 14-year-old sister as she hurried to help her brother.
lead_paragraph: After one officer shot Tamir Rice, 12, he and another officer stood by and did not help the wounded boy. An officer also tackled the boy’s sister.

headline.main: Police Gave Boy No Aid After Shooting in Cleveland
headline.print_headline: Police Gave Boy No Aid After Shooting in Cleveland
